name: amazon-bedrock-copilot-chat
displayName: Amazon Bedrock Provider for GitHub Copilot Chat
description: Amazon Bedrock integration using VSCode's official Language Model Chat Provider API. Connects AWS Bedrock models (Claude, OpenAI OSS, DeepSeek) to GitHub Copilot Chat via AWS SDK. Supports streaming, tool calling, and vision.

bedrock.region.description: AWS region for Amazon Bedrock API calls

bedrock.profile.description: AWS named profile from ~/.aws/credentials. Leave empty to use default credentials chain (environment variables, IAM roles, SSO, etc.)

bedrock.preferredModel.description: Preferred Amazon Bedrock model ID to use by default (e.g., 'anthropic.claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022-v2:0'). Leave empty to let Copilot choose.

bedrock.thinking.enabled.description: Enable extended thinking for supported Anthropic Claude models (Opus 4.1, Opus 4, Sonnet 4.5, Sonnet 4, Sonnet 3.7). Allows models to reason through complex tasks before responding.

bedrock.thinking.budgetTokens.description: Number of tokens allocated for thinking. Minimum 1024. Note: For Anthropic Claude models, this is automatically calculated as 20% of the model's maximum output tokens and this setting is ignored.

enumDescriptions: Maximum capability—Claude uses as many tokens as needed for the best possible outcome. Recommended for complex reasoning and difficult coding problems.
Balanced approach with moderate token savings. Good for tasks requiring a balance of speed, cost, and performance.
Most efficient—significant token savings with some capability reduction. Best for simpler tasks that need speed and lowest costs.
bedrock.thinking.effort.description: Thinking effort level for Claude Opus 4.5. Controls how eager Claude is about spending tokens when responding. Higher effort = better quality but more tokens.

bedrock.context1M.enabled.description: Enable 1M context window for Claude Sonnet 4.x models. When enabled, these models can handle up to 1 million tokens of input context. Note: Using 1M context increases API costs.

bedrock.promptCaching.enabled.description: Enable prompt caching for supported models to reduce latency and costs. Caches system prompts, tool definitions, and recent tool results. Disable if you need fully fresh responses or want to avoid cache-related costs.
